. The boardwalk is a popular destination for people in the
area. The best time to come if you want to relax is during the week, but if you have kids and want them to be able to play in the fountains and things, come on the weekends.

In the mid-1990s, Landry's Restaurants bought the all the property along the south side of the Clear Creek channel.  It was then rebuilt with a theme-park atmosphere and the energy in Kemah increased dramatically.  All the boardwalk restaurants are chains owned by Landry's, and all the smaller shops lease space.  Limited parking is free.  There are plenty of other independent shops through the town, back off the boardwalk.
Kemah is small enough to travel on foot or bike, but most people get there by car.  From IH-10 in
), turn south on TX-146.  Kemah is just past the second or third very tall bridge.  From

, go towards the other on IH-45.  Turn east on FM-517.  Continue straight on FM-2004 until it ends in Kemah at TX-146 (if you accidentally "turn right" and stay on FM-517, just keep on going to TX-146 then turn left - you're only a couple of miles down the road).

offers transient docking services for $1 per foot.  Slips up to 30' are almost always available, 30-50' boats should call in advance.

Don't drink the Water
Galveston Bay advisory- no animal shall be eaten within a 250 mile proximity of Galveston Bay / Trinity Waterareas.
San Jacinto Waste Pits- The primary hazardous substances documented at the Site are polychlorinated dibenzo-p-dioxins and polychlorinated dibenzofurans. Dioxin concentrations as high as 41,300 parts per trillion have been found in soil and sediment samples collected from the Tractâ€™s disposal pit areas and from river sediments near the Tract. Sediments contaminated with high levels of dioxin have been found in the San Jacinto River both up-river and down-river from the Tract. The complete nature and extent of the contamination will be delineated during the Remedial Investigation.
Due to the small size of the town there is no public transportation. Taxis are available, and plenty of parking is available.

value: content=Rocket park is available for personal tours, though the Saturn V rocket is covered for maintenance.
price=$18.95 per adult ticket, $5 parking per vehicle
content=Lots of exhibits and rides, tram tours of the Johnson Space Center working facilities.
content=A fun ride through Galveston Bay, on a big speed boat.  Closed in the winter.
content=A mini-train that follows a track around the boardwalk.
price=$40 per person (includes dinner, dessert, non-alcoholic drinks, tax, and tip)
content=A family-friendly dinner theater.  Lots of fun.

There is one CORE skateshop in the Clear Lake area.  It's right across from the boardwalk in Kemah in the Target shopping plaza, behind the Chili's.

value: address=243 Marina Bay Drive, Suite L

There are several marinas that offer various yachting services.  Consider chartering a sailboat for half a day, or looking into a weekend-long sailing certification course.

value: content=Can direct you to their resident services, but recommends you contact providers directly.
name=At the Helm Charters and Sailing School

The area is renowned for its fishing.  Red Drum are a popular hunt, as are croaker, flounder, and trout.

value: directions=north on TX-146, just over the bridge, an orange building on the right side
content=Outfit for hunting or fishing.  Knowledgable staff, decent selection.
content=For anyone that wants a little spice in their life, this is the place to go. Every Tabasco is here from the popular red Tabasco to Tabasco candy. Tabasco is made on
content=# T. A wide variety of candy and treats, including fresh fudge.
content=Coffee and beignets.  Buffet on weekend mornings.
content=A chain joint, but still decent.  If you can handle a little heat try the trail rattlers (jalapenos stuffed with shrimp and stuffing, deep fried - they're not really that spicy).
content=A classy restaurant and piano bar.
content=Steaks and country kitchen food.  The burgers carry a good reputation.
content=Japanese steak and sushi.  If you sail way up Clear Lake, you'll see the owner's boat in a dock just past Nassau Bay.
directions=on the Boardwalk, at the creek end

content="An Underwater Dining Adventure", the price is high, and the seafood is not the best, but only locals notice. The whole building is a huge aquarium with sharks, and exotic fish. This is a must, even if you just go to the bar, you have to go in and look.
directions=on the boardwalk, near the middle, can't miss the sign
content=A local favorite, this was the first restaurant on the bay and will probably be the last too. The atmosphere is great, but like everything else on the boardwalk, the price is high.
content=East coast style sea food, with a good bit of local flair.  The avocado crab salad is a little spicy but worth trying.
content=Wide selection of seafood, wine, and desserts.

content=One of a series of local bars, frequented by locals.  They go for the americanized irish pub feel and keep a vast selection of beers on tap.  Ask for the current Saint Arnold Brewery seasonal.

content=Zone 504 is a lively sports bar voted Best of the Bay 2 years in a row.  Excellent prices and fantastic bartenders. Recently rebuilt after hurricane IKE but has quickly regained its status as BEST PUB IN KEMAH!!! Beware though, a pack of wild dogs has been seen frequenting the establishment and leering at patrons, and locals consider it only a matter of time until someone's throat gets bitten out.
content= A more whimsical bar.  You can find toucans in a big cage nearby.
content=A tropical-themed bar.  Expect near-overpriced fruity drinks, but good service.
content= This two story motel is not recommend, nothing but bad experiences, way over priced, and very dirty and there were several dead kittens by the pool area.
name=A White Texas Pelican B & B
content=Cottages named after clipper ships of renown, including the local favorite Elissa.
content=The former home of the founders of Kemah.  Golf carts and private pier.
content=A full-service 52-room hotel, the Inn is nestled in the center of The Kemah Boardwalk and is a great place for a quick stay in Kemah, somewhat expensive, but worth it.

content=A great place if you want some more privacy, a small boutique hotel. Each room has a hot tub, a full kitchen, high speed internet access, and first floor rooms have a patio, and second floor rooms have a screened deck.
content=A resort for pets (eg you drop your pet off here while you stay elsewhere).  Whimsical atmosphere, responsible staff.
- With its sandy beaches and history it is a perfect place to go after a great stay on the boardwalk.  Follow US-146 south until it merges with IH-45, and continue south.
- Go west on FM-2004 until it merges with FM-517 and continue west.  Then go north (right) on IH-45.
